page.title: 03Milking on a Marnhull farm.
page.content: On a 380 acre Marnhull farm there are 170 cows, mostly friesians because they give more milk and better calves. A cow gives about 7.5 gallons of milk a day and 1400 gallons per lactation. The milk goes to Vauxhall in London via Wincanton. As well as dairy cows they also have 45 beef cattle,60 friesian and 20 young heifers as replacements,as they don't buy any livestock from the market.The cattle eat additional food such as cow cake and minerals every day and barley for young animals.They keep other animals-6 geese,1 sow and 8 hens. During summer milking is from 06.30 till 08.30 hrs.From 10.00 there is silaging or hay making all through the day until 20.30 at night.Second milking is at 16.00,and then feeding of young stock goes on until 18.30.
